    • Field Detail

      • subtractMode

        private boolean subtractMode

        Comparator mode

        Comparison mode - compares rear signal with side signals Subtract mode - subtraction between rear signal and side signals

      • forceUpdate

        private boolean forceUpdate

        Force update to take place

        Forces an update even if the inputs haven't changed, in case the comparator changes modes

      • power

        private int power

        Power being outputted

        Comparator outputs power if: - In comparison mode: rear signal is greater than the side signals, then outputs the rear signal - In subtract mode: subtracts rear signal with side signals (the maximum of the signals), then outputs the result value

      • powers

        private java.util.Map<Side,​java.lang.Integer> powers

        Table of power levels being received by the comparator

      • rear

        private Side rear

        Store rear side to improve updates performance

    • Constructor Detail

      • ComparatorTile

        public ComparatorTile​(Position position)

        Oriented tile constructor

        Comparator is a type of oriented tile that compares/subtracts the signals received and outputs accordingly It has one output side, and three input sides (one in the rear, two on the side) The input side on the opposing side of the output is the main signal The other two inputs are the comparator signals
        Parameters:
        position - Position of the tile

    • Method Detail

      • rotateLeft

        public boolean rotateLeft​(Circuit circuit)

        Rotates a tile to the left

        In an oriented tile rotating a tile to the left is switching the types of the sides in clock-wise direction In addition updates the rear side of the comparator
        Overrides:
        rotateLeft in class OrientedTile
        Parameters:
        circuit - Circuit where rotation is taking place
        Returns:
        true

      • rotateRight

        public boolean rotateRight​(Circuit circuit)

        Rotates a tile to the right

        In an oriented tile rotating a tile to the right is switching the types of the sides in clock-wise direction In addition updates the rear side of the comparator
        Overrides:
        rotateRight in class OrientedTile
        Parameters:
        circuit - Circuit where rotation is taking place
        Returns:
        true

      • getRear

        public Side getRear()

        Get rear side of the comparator

        If comparator has no inputs and rear side is up-to-date then the value is null
        Returns:
        Rear side

      • updateRear

        public void updateRear()

        Updates rear side

        If there's no output side, rear side will be set to null

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()

        Get name of the tile

        Specified by:
        getName in class Tile
        Returns:
        "comparator"

      • getInfo

        public java.lang.String getInfo()

        Get tile information

        Specified by:
        getInfo in class Tile
        Returns:
        "Mode : " followed by "comparison" or "subtract" "Power : " followed by the power the comparator is outputting

      • getPower

        public int getPower​(Side side)

        Get the power level emitted on the side specified

        Specified by:
        getPower in class Tile
        Parameters:
        side - Side of the tile
        Returns:
        Comparator power if it's the output side, minimum power otherwise

      • setOutput

        public void setOutput​(int power)

        Sets comparator output power level

        The new power level gets clamped to assure it's always a valid power level
        Parameters:
        power - New power level

      • getSubtractMode

        public boolean getSubtractMode()

        Gets the comparator mode

        Returns:
        false if timer is in Comparison mode, true for Subtract mode

      • setSubtractMode

        public void setSubtractMode​(boolean mode)

        Changes the comparator mode

        For Comparison mode set mode to false For Subtract mode set mode to true
        Parameters:
        mode - New timer mode

      • update

        public boolean update​(Circuit circuit,
                      int power,
                      Side side)

        Triggers a tile update

        Checks if comparator needs to be updated
        Overrides:
        update in class Tile
        Parameters:
        circuit - Circuit where updates are taking place
        power - Power received on the update
        side - Side from which comparator received an update
        Returns:
        true if comparator was updated, false otherwise
